Function Documentation

bool tree_add_node_inst (  module *    mod,
tree_node *    root,
char *    curr_inst
) 
 

Adds specified module node to the specified module tree based on instance name.

Parameters:
mod  Pointer to module to add to the specified tree.
root  Pointer to root node of the tree.
curr_inst  Name of current module instance being parsed.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if parent module instance found and node added successfully; otherwise, returns FALSE.
Adds specified tree node to a tree. The process to add will go like this:
  1. Look through entire tree_node list starting at root, looking for parent module based on scope.
  2. If parent module found, add this module to its child list and return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.

bool tree_add_node_mod (  module *    mod,
tree_node *    root,
char *    curr_mod
) 
 

Adds specified module node to the specified module tree based on module name.

Parameters:
mod  Pointer to module to add to the specified tree.
root  Pointer to root node of the tree.
curr_mod  Name of current module being parsed.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if module is not excluded from coverage; otherwise, return FALSE.
Adds specified tree node to a tree. The process to add will go like this:
  1. If this module is specified to not be covered, exit this function immediately.
  2. Look through entire tree_node list starting at root, looking for parent module.
  3. If parent module found, add this module to its child list.

void tree_db_write (  tree_node *    root,
FILE *    file
) 
 

Outputs contents of entire module tree to specified file.

Parameters:
root  Pointer to root of current tree.
file  Pointer to output file.
Recursively outputs all modules of tree to database file. All parents are output before their children.

void tree_dealloc (  tree_node *    tnode ) 
 

Deallocates memory for tree node back to heap memory.

Parameters:
tnode  Pointer to tree node to deallocate.
Recursively deallocates all nodes beneath and including the specified tree node.

tree_node* tree_find_module (  char *    modname,
bool    chkname,
char *    scope,
bool    chkscope,
int    fname_comp,
tree_node *    root
) 
 

Searches tree list for specified module.

Parameters:
modname  Name of module to find in tree.
chkname  If set to TRUE, uses specified module name to check against.
modscope  Scope of module to find in the tree.
chkscope  If set to TRUE, uses specified module scope to check against.
fname_comp  Specifies strictness of matching the module filename.
root  Root module node of tree.
Returns:
Pointer to found module node or NULL if not found.
Recursively searches the contents of the tree for the specified module node. If a match is found, returns a pointer to this module; otherwise, returns a value of NULL.

tree_node* tree_node_create (  module *    mod ) 
 

Creates a new node to be added to the tree.

Parameters:
mod  Pointer to module to initialize tree node with.
Returns:
Returns pointer to newly created tree node.
Allocates memory from the heap for the specified tree node, initializes the node with the specified module and initializes the rest of the pointers to NULL.

Variable Documentation

str_link* no_score_head
 

Pointer to head element of modules not-to-score list
